steps.title: Step 1: What is Python?
steps.description: Python is a programming language. It's like a special set of instructions that we can give to the computer to make it do things for us.

steps.title: Step 2: Print Statement
steps.description: The print statement is used to display a message on the screen. It helps us communicate with the computer and see what it's doing.

steps.title: Step 3: Variables
steps.description: Variables are like containers where we can store information. We give each container a name, and then we can use that name to refer to the information inside.

steps.title: Step 4: Data Types
steps.description: Data types tell us what type of information we're working with. For example, text is a different type of data than numbers.

steps.title: Step 5: Loops
steps.description: Loops help us repeat a set of instructions multiple times. It's like telling the computer to do something over and over again.
steps.codeSnippet:
for i in range(5):
    print('Hello, world!')

steps.title: Step 6: Conditionals
steps.description: Conditionals help us make decisions in our code. We can tell the computer to do one thing if a condition is true, and another thing if it's false.
